attributes.action: Remove the need for planning permission for energy efficiency improvements
attributes.background: We want the Government to amend planning legislation so that energy efficiency improvements, such as schemes to install double glazing and doors, including UPVC framed, do not require planning permission. Only grade 1 listed buildings should be excluded.
attributes.additional_details:
I live in a village which is partly a conservation area. The local council seems to systematically refuse planning permission for UPVC windows.
 
As a consequence of this we have many older buildings with windows in poor condition and which could be better insulated.
 
UPVC framed windows are much cheaper than wooden frames, require hardly any maintenance, and can appear very similar to wooden frames.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Remove the need for planning permission to mount solar panels on flat roofs.
attributes.background: Many UK properties have outbuildings with flat roofs that could be used to mount solar panels. These are currently subject to planning laws if the panels extend 20cm from the "plane" of the roof. Mounting them flat to avoid this requirements is inefficient.
attributes.additional_details:
Modify the planning requirements to allow panels to be mounted on a flat roof providing they do not extend above the roof of the main property.
This could allow many more home owners to install Solar panels with far more ease and assist the government in meeting it's targets for reducing carbon emissions. This could also help households in this time of energy uncertainty, increase jobs through supply and demand and reduce the demand on the National Grid.

attributes.action: Pay for the Cost of Living with minimum 50% Windfall Tax & then <50% Borrowing
attributes.background: The people of the UK shouldn’t have to pay for freezing energy bills this winter, by borrowing and adding to the national debt, when the energy companies are making £170bn+ in profits.
attributes.additional_details: That’s why we ask that a minimum of 50% of the cost of living plan should be paid for by windfall tax and no more than 50% of the cost by borrowing.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Your petition both asks that more than (<) 50% of borrowing and a maximum of 50% borrowing. If you mean less than (>) 50% borrowing then we're not sure how you'd like any gap between a 50% windfall tax and less than 50% borrowing to be funded.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Hold referendum on paying for the energy crisis: windfall tax or borrowing
attributes.background:
I think the people of the UK should be allowed to decide how we pay back the money we borrow for easing the energy crisis. 

Should we risk future investment, and tax the oil and gas companies or should we pass the debt on to our children and future generations in the UK?
attributes.additional_details: Because it is the democratic way to do things, as we have been told about the Brexit referendum.

attributes.action: Save East Anglia’s historic landscape from 180km Pylons!
attributes.background: Protect East Anglia from 1300 pylons over 180km from Tilbury to Norwich. The proposal by the National Grid will destroy thousands of trees and scar the beautiful landscape of East Anglia, putting the setting of hundreds of listed buildings at risk and threaten the tourist and hospitality industry.
attributes.additional_details: To secure Englands green and pleasant land while ensuring that green energy reaches the public but in a green-friendly way. Cables underground throughout, not just AONB or Replace the need for pylons by creating an off shore ring main to take green energy where it’s needed.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is currently the subject of a consultation by National Grid.

attributes.action: Unleash this nation of entrepreneurs by transforming Start Up funding
attributes.background: Transform the Start Up Loan scheme to be more like student loans, but for entrepreneurs: Government-backed, low interest, unsecured loans available to anyone, at any age, who wants to start a business. Like a student loan, the entrepreneur loan only becomes repayable when you earn enough.
attributes.additional_details: The number one barrier to starting a business is lack of money. Ordinary working people cannot risk quitting their jobs, defaulting on mortgages, and plunging their family into poverty in order to pursue their aspirations. We are a nation of creative entrepreneurs at heart. Yet so much of that talent is wasted. We need to uncork that energy and offer everyone, no-matter their walk of life, the opportunity to build something incredible. It is a national economic imperative. It's social mobility for a generation and rocket fuel for our economy.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Require employers to compensate workers if shifts are cancelled at short notice
attributes.background: We want the Government to make a law in favour of all shift workers for cancellation of shifts in last minutes by the employer.
attributes.additional_details: As it cause wastage of time ,effort and energy by reaching on site but at last minutes you come to know that shifts has been cancelled.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Extend Bounce Back Loan repayment terms
attributes.background: Extend BBLS repayment options to include two more 6 month periods of interest only and a term extension option to 15 years. Further interest only periods should be usable immediately after the current lower payment options expire. Additional interest only periods should be usable consecutively.
attributes.additional_details:
Given the current economic crisis, the Treasury should mitigate the effects of the energy crisis and 40 year high inflation on top of post Covid recovery.

The proposed adjustment to the BBLS repayment terms is preferable to allowing an accelerated rate of defaults over and above what we would have had from Covid economic fallout alone.

This saves tax payers money, reduces debt collection burden for banks, lessens the pressure on court systems and helps businesses at a critical time.

attributes.action: We the people demand that the Conservative Party call a General Election in 2022
attributes.background: The nation has zero confidence in Liz Truss and this Conservative government. The government has almost ruined the nation through thoughtlessly offering the richest minority of our nation massive tax cuts, causing the devaluation of the pound, and seriously harming  the mortgage market.
attributes.additional_details: I want Liz Truss to call a General Election. This is because of both her own and her predecessors, inability to lead the nation. Please, out of respect for the British people, call an election. We face a winter of discontent with no contingency provision for energy scarcity. The government will inevitably seek to cut public spending during this most vulnerable time in our recent national history putting an already fragile NHS and social care system at risk of total collapse

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/619781

The Petitions Committee has scheduled a debate on the above petition for Monday 17 October.

attributes.action: Make the use of Tasers (conducted energy weapon) & Pava spray legal
attributes.background: Make the use of Tasers (conducted energy weapon) & Pava spray legal For the use by security professionals with specialist training and a new SIA license with intensive training and police vetting for use by door supervisors & close protection operatives to deal with serious and violent attacks
attributes.additional_details: I would like the government to make this legal because it can help combat the threat of serious and violent crime in communities when there is a imminent threat to the public and the security teams. There is a lot of times where the police response maybe delayed when serious incidents are taking place and that leaves the security professionals defenceless when it come to dealing with weapons and serious assaults when trying to protect the public.

attributes.action: Recall parliament to debate the energy price cap and offer real help for all
attributes.background: End the parliamentary recess and recall parliament to debate the energy price cap increase and offer real assistance for all.
attributes.additional_details: The current government have known the energy price cap announcement will be happening on Friday 26th August for a number of months, but have been unable/unwilling to offer assistance to the public. The latest price cap announcement will be of concern to many with little signs of activity within the government. The price cap should be of the highest priority for the government, rather than hosting a recess for a zombie government.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621634

attributes.action: For Ofgem to freeze the price cap now
attributes.background: Ofgem to freeze the price cap and review this at a future date to avoid making cost of living crisis worse.
attributes.additional_details: As people are struggling to pay basic costs. Energy suppliers are making profits so there should be no need, in the current climate, to increase the price cap any further.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a very similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621634

attributes.action: Bring in promised legislation to regulate heat networks to give users parity
attributes.background:
The Government promised to bring in new regulation to oversee heat networks and ensure  customers get the same rights as other energy customers - but there's no sign of it yet.
This legislation is needed urgently, especially with today's energy price crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently there's no regulator overseeing heat networks, so customers don't have the rights standard gas and electricity customers have.
 You can't switch supplier if you're unhappy with the service or price. Providers are usually contracted to supply a site for 25 years or more, there's little incentive to offer a deal right for customers.
It is vital the government acts quickly to keeps to its promise to regulate heat networks and give customers the rights they need during this energy crisis

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Do not require a Energy Performance rating of "C" for private lets after 2025/28
attributes.background: The Government is consulting on a proposal to require a "C" Energy Performance rating for all new privately rented homes from 2025, and all properties from 2028. We believe these requirements should not be implemented.
attributes.additional_details:
We want Energy Performance Certificate minimum rating standards, after the year 2025 (for new properties) and 2028 (for all properties), to be kept at the present level and the proposal to have a minimum EPC rating of "C" for all properties, within PRS, to be abandoned!
 
Many operators, including professionals, within the private rented sector feel, especially in the case of historic homes/old homes, that Government targets for Energy Performance certificates are unobtainable!

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Increase the work from home expense flat rates for self-employed people
attributes.background: Currently the simplified working from home rates for self-employed people who work from home are £10-26 a week. These rates haven't changed in a number of years and with the recent hikes in energy bills and other household costs, these rate need to be increased too.
attributes.additional_details: These rates haven't changed in a long time and the costs of working from home have increased since these rates were set. Increasing these rates will make it simpler for self-employed workers to reclaim a greater proportion of the cost of working from home.

attributes.action: Cut fuel Tax due to the rising oil prices to help motorists when filling up
attributes.background: Because of the current energy crisis and the war in Ukraine the price of this oil has give through the roof meaning motorists are paying substantially more at the pumps, we would fuel tax cut to mitigate this.
attributes.additional_details: Cut fuel tax to bring down fuel prices at the pumps

rejection.details:
We currently have the following petitions open on this topic:

Reduce fuel duty and VAT by 40% for a period of 2 years
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599089

Remove VAT from all domestic fuel, and provide price capping on heating oil.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/598647

Stop charging VAT on fuel duty
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599411

Hold an inquiry into fuel prices and introduce increased regulation
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/603624

Suspend the green levies on domestic fuel immediately.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607977

attributes.action: Re-instate the price cap on energy companies
attributes.background: Reduce energy bills, make energy companies that recorded insane amounts of profits over the last few years to absorb the increase
attributes.additional_details:
Energy companies are making record profits year after year, receiving subsidies and assisted by the uk government costing the tax payer. 
The tactic France have taken over this is a true commitment to its people, making sure energy cost do not increase for families and making these big energy companies make the up the difference. The government needs to stop squeezing every last penny from struggling families.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Ofgem continues to set a price cap for energy. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: I want an enquiry into the high rise in petrol and diesel prices
attributes.background:
Investigate the reasons behind the high increases in petrol and diesel prices.
The people of this country have been hit by many increases in energy, food, council tax etc and now petrol prices.
attributes.additional_details:
Investigate how much the government, manufacturers and businesses are profiting from such increases and instigate  a plan of action to bring them to task and make them reduce prices accordingly.
People do not a money tree to keep grabbing off branches, what they do have is desperation, mental health, suicide and many more issues brought about purely by greed.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

We could accept a petition calling for an inquiry into the reasons for increases in fuel prices, but the Government is not responsible for fuel prices, so we could not accept a petition calling on them to "make [manufacturers and businesses] reduce prices accordingly".

The House of Commons Library has produced a briefing on petrol and diesel prices, which may be of interest: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/research-briefings/sn04712/

As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

attributes.action: Lower energy bills and stop these companies from feeding off the poor
attributes.background: Make it law that energy prices are fair instead of unjust
attributes.additional_details: Your job

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about energy prices, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

The calculation of the energy price cap is a matter for the regulator Ofgem, which is operationally independent of the UK Government and House of Commons. You can find out more about how the price cap is calculated here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/information-consumers/energy-advice-households/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Temporarily suspend all taxes on all fuels and energy bills: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610585

Subsidise a 'basic' amount of electricity for households: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616915

Establish a not-for-profit state owned energy provider: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617446

Introduce a "Triple lock" to restrict energy cap increases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621347

Recall Parliament to consider the Energy Price Cap Increase (Cancellation) Bill: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621634

attributes.action: Reduce the energy price cap and return it to annual increase/decrease
attributes.background: Look at the energy price cap which is going up almost 4 fold. The energy companies are making vast profits, even with the one off windfall tax. The price cap increased by 54% in April, is set to increase by 70% in October. The Government must cap the October rise and cancel the planned 2023 rises
attributes.additional_details: The increase in price caps were to reduce energy companies going into liquidation. Those fails were relatively new companies, many set up for the lucrative profits to be had and were inefficient/badly managed. The larger, long standing energy companies are now making vast profits. Already 1 large company (EON) saying customer debt is at £1.3bn. Their profits a staggering £3.4bn for 1st 6 months of 2022. If price cap continues as planned, more customers will fall into debt creating more poverty.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The fixing of the Energy Price Cap is a decision for Ofgem and not the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Enable the Government to access Bank of England GRANTS to fund Public Services!
attributes.background: The current methods of funding Public Services through taxation, borrowing & profits from the Public Sector limit the UK Government’s ability to improve Public Services and Living Standards. If the UK Government didn't have limited finance available to it, it could be capable of greater investment.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government should be able to fund spending on Public Services from the Bank of England to Improve Living Standards.

The Government could use this funding to increase Minimum Wage, Pensions, Improve Public Services like the NHS and protect our Planet better.

Government can also help finance Scientific & Medical Research much better. Financial Incentives and Support can be given by Government to Industries to go Carbon Neutral & Energy Providers to produce Clean & Renewable Energy.

attributes.action: Force energy retailers to keep loyal customers on their lowest price tariff
attributes.background: Gas and electricity consumers who do not switch supplier are currently heavily penalised for their loyalty. The people who switch are computer savvy, moneywise and willing to make the effort to frequently switch suppliers. They are generally well off. The poor are therefore subsidising the wealthy
attributes.additional_details:
Only 21% of gas and electricity consumers switch suppliers to take advantage of price competition (UK Power - 'How many people switch energy?'). The majority of people who switch are well educated, computer savvy, moneywise and probably wealthy.
The market is therefore not supporting the government's intention of 'levelling up' the uk economy. On the contrary, the current regime favours the wealthy and disadvantages the less wealthy. Forcing utility companies to reward customer loyalty will achieve significant levelling up with little or no government expenditure and remove an immense amount of hassle from the lives of uk citizens.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Individual energy providers are responsible for deciding on energy charges, subject to rules set by Ofgem, including price caps: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/energy-price-caps/consumers

As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

attributes.action: Plant more flowers “everywhere” to support the bees.
attributes.background: Plant more flowers, ones which attract pollinating insects anywhere and everywhere which has plain soil, around the borders of any grassy/plain soil areas, either side of public walk paths where there is grassy/plain soil, roundabouts, road sides, motorways, empty fields, etc.
attributes.additional_details: Bees are exhausted, they travel for miles and miles searching for food/flowers. When i walk out my front door I see concrete and bricks for miles and miles. I would really like to see more flowers everywhere, wherever they can be planted specifically to support butterflies and bees, as we all know they have an important role. The Earth looks more beautiful and healthy with colour, more flowers means more energy for the bees, the less they have to travel the easier they will thrive.

rejection.details:
Planting flowers is a matter for individual local authorities and private landowners, not the Government or House of Commons.

We could accept a petition calling for the Government to provide funding to support increased planting to support bees, if that's something you would like to see happen.

attributes.action: Discount Energy Bills for everyone
attributes.background: Offer discounted rates or free energy bills throughout the Coronavirus lockdowns
attributes.additional_details: As a mother for two small children I have found we are in the house during winter using more electric trying to keep them entertained and more gas keeping them warm. I have a 2.5 year old and an almost 5 month old who both need to be warm and be entertained. My husband works and I am on maternity leave, we have since used almost double what we would have used before the pandemic. It should not matter that we are a working class family, and do not require any benefits from the government... the only people benefitting from this pandemic is the Energy suppliers!

rejection.details: The Government is not directly responsible for the cost of energy, this is a matter for individual energy providers and Ofgem, but you might like to sign this petition calling for a related action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/565591

attributes.action: Permit singles tennis games on outdoor courts during lockdown
attributes.background:
Singles tennis games comply with  'exercise outdoors with one other person'. 
Social distancing is maintained: 2 opponents remain 40+ ft apart throughout the game. Maintaining mental health is very important: tennis allows energy release & distanced interaction.
attributes.additional_details:
Playing a physically strenuous game that has an intrinsic purpose is an enjoyable and effortful release of energy, calming mind and keeping body healthy.
Most importantly, if people are allowed to exercise outdoors with one other person, a singles tennis game meets this criteria fully. In this instance, how is it lawful to exclude this particular sport from the list of permitted activities when it so clearly meets the criteria set by Government?

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Allow indoor/outdoor tennis courts to operate under strict distancing protocols: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557428

Exempt outdoor tennis from closure due to COVID-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557658

attributes.action: Keep dance classes open in covid 19 its a learning activity
attributes.background: I want dance classes to stay open in covid 19 its a learning activity and is a way children express  there emotion and energy
attributes.additional_details: I have a 3 year old girl that been doing dance for nearly 2 years and she love it she dances where ever she goes she has become so good at this and so has so many in her dance class the classes are kept separate and all the girls love going to dance to express all there emotion and release all there energy they all keep there distance from each other and all understand whats going on so why can't they stay open this isn't fair children need routine and stability

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557275

attributes.action: Prioritise the development of a sustainable circular economy.
attributes.background: Up to 99% of goods end up in landfills or are burned to produce fuel (EfW) within 6 months of purchase. This is both inherently wasteful and bad for the planet. An SCE makes better use of resources than our current linear economy, prevents waste and pollution, and provides employment in recycling.
attributes.additional_details: For the sake of current and future generations, we have to be more responsible in our use of resources. Energy from Waste (EfW) has only minor benefits - producing fuel - as against major deficits - waste of resources and increased pollution. A linear economy uses increasing amounts of virgin resources which is unsustainable. Recycling is still underutilized. An ESC would be a sustainable economy going forward into the future. This is based on research from the University of Leeds.

rejection.details:
We understand that you want the Government to make the UK more sustainable, but it's not clear what action you want the Government to take to achieve this. We can only accept petitions that request a clear action.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Rebuild the economy out of lockdown with a Green New Deal: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317343

Publish new carbon budgets linked to the Paris Agreement and Climate Change Act: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300178

Make recycling a legal obligation: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331864

attributes.background: Everyone, the NHS, to local communities pulling together to help the vulnerable and each other. While people are losing jobs, households are forced to stay at home, the energy companies are rubbing their hands in disbelief as household energy bills soar.
attributes.additional_details: Everyone from the glorious NHS, to local communities pulling together to help the vulnerable and each other. Politicians from all parties are unprecedented in speaking with one voice in the knowledge that we are living in destructing times. While people are losing jobs, households are forced to stay at home, the energy companies are rubbing their hands in disbelief as household energy bills soar.

Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

attributes.action: Uk to suspend mortgages all mortgages, council tax and bills to alleviate burden
attributes.background:
In this difficult times people are forced to take unnecessary risks and chose between their health an the economical impact.
It is time that the government take a stand and make assurances. The £78 does not go far enough,
attributes.additional_details:
Many, homeowners rely on their earnings to pay their bills that runs into thousands a month.
Even though some has the opportunity to work from home, because of the nature of their job, many cannot. Several people still make the effort to battle through, but the earnings are down, adding extra burden to every household. 
It’s time for the UK show that they care.
Banks, councils energy provided have made enough profit in the past to see us through this difficult times.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302256

attributes.action: The government to take control of the British energy companies ensuring morality
attributes.background: Using law, sieze control of the British energy companies to ensure standards of fairness are upheld. Principally to make sure fair morally and ethical standards are maintained for the British public.
attributes.additional_details: Energy rises have been thrust upon the British people that do not match inflation in any way. Excuses have been made, but the control of British energy companies by Europe is ensuring we are punished. Because this is morally wrong, we should take control of this ourselves in Britain. Use the renewable energy sources as much as possible ourselves. Pass much of the savings to the public.

attributes.action: Free solar panels on all residential properties to end reliance on fossil fuels
attributes.background:
Redirect the hundreds of billions allocated to new nuclear to a programme to ensure that all residential properties are offered installation of solar panels at zero cost to the property owner or energy consumer.
Not only is this far cleaner and cheaper, it starts generating immediately!!
attributes.additional_details:
The current proposed strategy is entirely focussed on new nuclear. 
Not only does this cost billions to build, it will be a decade before they generate a single watt, taking us to at least 2032.
Added to this, the end to end costs including decommissioning end of life stations and storage of spent fuel into infinity is obscene. 
To commit to build,the generator, (EDF) is guaranteed price per GW 
Consumers will have a levy attached to future bills to pay for both the build and inflated energy costs

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same/a similar action:  https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/613855

attributes.action: Introduce a fuel price cap and/or tax reduction to combat the energy crisis
attributes.background: Introduce a fuel price cap and/or a fuel duty and VAT reduction to combat the current energy and cost of living crisis before the economy reaches a critical point at risk of potential collapse.
attributes.additional_details: In the last year fuel and energy prices have increased by at least 50-60% leaving many British households already struggling to make ends meet in a dire situation.  Minimum wage is due to increase by a mere 6% in April, which is not comparative to the inflation of fuel, energy and other bills which have increased the cost of living exponentially.  The current direction of the economy is on an unsustainable path forcing millions below the poverty line.

attributes.action: Exploit our vast underground gas reserves to fight fuel poverty.
attributes.background: With soaring energy bills and rocketing fuel poverty, we must recover our domestic oil and gas reserves. The British government must instruct the Oil and Gas Authority that recovering onshore gas and developing offshore oil is an overwhelming national priority.
attributes.additional_details:
Just 10% of the 37.6 trillion cubic meters of gas in the Bowland Shale formations under Northern England would meet UK gas needs for fifty years, and ensure energy security.
There are further gas reserves under Scotland's Forth Valley and elsewhere in the UK.
We need this gas both for fuel and as industrial feedstock for essential manufacturing.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the current increase in fuel prices, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

Decisions about applying to explore onshore gas reserves are a matter for individual oil and gas companies. We could accept a petition calling for changes to the framework for oil and gas exploration and exploitation, but it would need to be clear what changes you wanted to be made to existing rules.

attributes.action: Remove Electricity/Utility Company Standing Charges
attributes.background: Why do Electricity/Utility Companies have a daily standing charge? The Government needs to look at this in depth, the standing charge is soon rising, from 24.88p to approx 45p. A cost of £163 per annum without using any energy. This really needs to be scrapped for all.
attributes.additional_details: With the current UK housing stock at around 24 million dwellings, this means that Utility/ Electricity firms are due to earn over four billion pounds. An outrageous amount of money. £163 could help feed or heat thousands of the poorer families across the UK. For myself this constitutes at least a month's electricity and part towards our food bill. This would constitute a far better system of cutting the cost of heating and eating rather than the £200 proposed by the Gov. Which requires payback.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Deciding whether to recoup costs through standing charges and unit costs or just unit costs are a matter for individual energy providers.

attributes.action: Allow Dance studios to remain open during lockdown
attributes.background: Dance studios are a fundamental part of mental wellbeing in adults and children. It is an essential educational activity providing an outlet for life challenges.  Allow dance studios to remain open during any national or local lockdown, ensuring we have a mentally happier future generation.
attributes.additional_details: The impact of Covid-19 on the younger generation for not being able to continue with hobbies such as dance or sport has meant they have no outlet for energy, stress and any mental health concerns,  stoping these activities as further impacted this.  Dance is an educational setting for students to learn a new skill/talent and be inspired. Classes are done in a covid secure safe space. Online does not offer the same benefits that in studio classes do. People need this!

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557275

attributes.action: Ban the use of blue-rich lights for public lighting at night due to cancer risk
attributes.background: Owing to evidence that blue-rich lights used for some public lighting at night are associated with an elevated risk of prostate, breast and colorectal cancers, we believe that lights that are used for this purpose should be restricted to a correlated colour temperature of <3000K by law.
attributes.additional_details: Many street lights are being replaced with LEDs for energy efficiency reasons. Historically the most efficient LEDs had a high CCT value (4000K and over). Studies have shown that blue-rich lighting at night suppresses melatonin production, which can enhance the development of hormone-related cancers. The UK government should therefore mandate the use of low-CCT light sources for public lighting at night (<3000K) and require the replacement of any blue-rich sources within a reasonable time frame.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Stop a solar farm
attributes.background: Stop a solar farm being built in our beautiful countryside. I am born and bread in this area and the views and countryside will be spoiled for ever with this project
attributes.additional_details: The pleasure of living in a rural area is looking at our beautiful countryside. There is a proposal to build a solar farm in our community of which all the local residents are opposed to. There are a number of elderly residents that this is effecting already and the project has not even started you. We all understand the need for greener energy but not on our doorstep where it affects our views of the countryside. We want this project stopped in its track and moved to somewhere more suitable and less disruptive.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local planning decisions are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Freeze energy costs. Enforce a maximum profit margin for suppliers/generators.
attributes.background: Energy companies have made excessive profits yet they ask government to pay grants to cover price increases to keep energy prices as the are. This is neither economic for the country or customers who will eventually have to pay the for these grants to the government through taxation.
attributes.additional_details: Ofgem are supposed to regulate companies and heir prices for the benefit of the consumer yet their current focus appears to be to keep energy generators/suppliers in business. These companies have made excessive profits and must be able to limit their profit margins and still pay dividnends to their shareholders. There is no need for further price increases for consumers. This strategy would prevent government paying grants to them or pay outs to consumers.

rejection.details:
The calculation of the energy price cap is a matter for the regulator Ofgem, which is operationally independent of the UK Government and House of Commons. You can find out more about how the price cap is calculated here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/information-consumers/energy-advice-households/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you.

You may be interested to know that the current energy price cap sets a maximum that suppliers can charge per unit of energy, and caps the level of profits an energy supplier can make to 1.9%. Ofgem are responsible for setting the energy price cap. You can find out more here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/publications/ofgem-confirms-changes-price-cap-methodology-and-frequency-ahead-new-rate-be-announced-later-month

You can find out more about the Government's Energy profits tax here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/cost-of-living-support/energy-profits-levy-factsheet-26-may-2022

attributes.action: Introduce subsidies and interest free loans for home solar energy systems
attributes.background: Provide subsidies and interest free loans to support UK citizens who would like to have solar energy systems, but the cost upfront is prohibitive.
attributes.additional_details: The initial capital investment (although this would be repayable loans for the most part) will be fairly large depending on uptake, but not crazy compared to all the support the gov is currently trying to provide. The benefits would last decades and reduce the UK energy deficit, help us become more self sufficient as well as massively accelerate the net zero targets set by the government. Give a person a fish, you feed them for one day, teach them how to fish and you’ll feed them for a lifetime

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/613855

You may be able to get a loan through the Green Deal scheme for energy-saving improvements to your home, including solar panels. You can find out more about this scheme here: https://www.gov.uk/green-deal-energy-saving-measures

attributes.action: Clarify what politicians earn from oil, gas and energy companies.
attributes.background: Make it a Legal obligation that any politician must declare any shares and earnings form oil and gas companies including energy suppliers.
attributes.additional_details: With the ever increasing costs to the public for all energy supplies. It’s only fair that anyone in public office declares any income from this sector. Using Tax payer money to fund any rebate or help, whilst knowing they’re reviving income from this sector is immoral.

rejection.details:
MPs are already require to declare all earnings, and only shareholdings that are worth more than £70k, or amount to more than 15% of total shares in a company.

We could accept a petition calling for MPs to be required to declare all shareholdings, if that's what you want to happen.

attributes.action: Make Energy Companies take only the money they are owed for any energy used.
attributes.background: I am on a standard variable tariff, but am told I have got to pay nearly double the amount each month to that of the actual cost of my energy. This is to protect the energy company, OVO in this case, form not getting paid in the future. Having got £117 in credit I had to ask for this to be refunded.
attributes.additional_details: Energy companies are holding customers money in their accounts earning interest for the company. The excess monies the companies are holding is preventing people from using all their disposable income to buy food and pay other bills and is helping to create food poverty and debt when there could be no need for it. Let people control their own finances when and if they want to. No other sector I know do or are allowed to charge for goods and services they have not yet provided.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about payment arrangements for energy supplies are a matter for individual energy suppliers and Ofgem, which regulates the UK energy sector. You can find out more about billing options suppliers have to offer here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/sites/default/files/docs/2019/02/licence_guide_metering_billing_and_payments_1.pdf

Ofgem has recently required improvements from energy suppliers on customer direct debits, which you can find out about here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/publications/press-release-ofgem-requires-improvements-energy-suppliers-customer-direct-debits

attributes.action: To divert our war budget to help British public inside Uk to cope with inflation
attributes.background: To stop or decrease funding and aids to wars outside Uk and then divert the money back to help Uk internal growth and stop the inflation that is killing British people at this moment. Stop energy prices and food costs increase at this fast pace.
attributes.additional_details: Because many of my friends are struggling in paying bills and their kids have not got enough food , clothes , warmth and education . And these will affect the future of UK .   This is an urgent time that we need to stop pretending to be international hero,  instead, we need to refocus on looking after our own British inside UK

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see certain Government funds redirected, but it's not clear if you want the UK's entire defence budget to be redirected to tackle the increased cost of living, or just funds that are directly spent on military conflicts.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Stop purchasing gas from Russia - the British people support this.
attributes.background: Encourage people in the UK to reduce thier energy consumption to help pave the way for stopping the purchase of gas from Russia.
attributes.additional_details: To support Ukraine and help bring an end to the abhorrent end invasion of the people of Ukraine.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Ban all imports of Russian oil and gas immediately: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610289

Since you started your petition the Government has announced plans to phase out Russian oil imports by the end of the year. Find out more here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/uk-to-phase-out-russian-oil-imports

And you can find details of the UK’s sanctions regime relating to Russia here: https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/uk-sanctions-on-russia

attributes.action: Reconsider the ban on fracking for gas
attributes.background: With the reliance on Russian gas the energy costs to the working man is not sustainable.
attributes.additional_details: Resume the fracking projects

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608745

attributes.action: Make the £200 Government Energy Bill loan an option rather than automatic
attributes.background: I would like the Government to re-think this and make it optional as opposed to something which happens automatically and give people a choice!
attributes.additional_details: This is a loan which has to be paid back, this is forced debt upon every single person who pays an energy bill and should be optional. I don’t want to pay an extra £40 a year for 5 years. I’d rather just not have this energy bill loan.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608007

attributes.action: Give extra payments to eligible families for energy bills while homeschooling.
attributes.background: Parliament need to discuss a way to make one off support payments to eligible families for their heating and electricity bills, on top of the Warm Homes discount. Warm Homes discount is given on the basis that children are at school in the week, and costs for electricity and heating would be less.
attributes.additional_details: Vulnerable families and those on low incomes are having to pay significantly higher costs towards heating and electricity whilst their children are homeschooling. Extortionate energy costs already force poorer families to choose between food and heating/electricity. During these difficult times, when incomes are already stretched, the extra burden of energy should be supported by the government.

rejection.details:
If you want all families home-schooling children to receive help with their energy bills you might like to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/567637

If you only want the Government to provide these payments to people on low incomes or receiving certain benefits you could start a new petition stating more clearly what support you want to be provided, and who to.

attributes.action: Increase UK content for UK Renewable / Energy projects and protect UK Jobs
attributes.background: Engage with developers at initial phase and enforce a majority  percentage of UK content supplied services / products.
attributes.additional_details: By ensuring a large number of skilled highly paid jobs it will only benefit the economy with the jump start it needs after the devastating levels of unemployment resulting after the Covid crisis. Also to deliver on promises / statements made by government after we leave the EU

rejection.details:
We understand you want more involvement for UK companies and materials in energy projects, however it's not clear what you want the Government to do to achieve this. Further, the materials and suppliers any individual business chooses to use would be a matter for them, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could start a petition calling on the Government to create a green jobs fund for which only UK residents are eligible, if that is something you'd like to happen.

attributes.action: Put David Attenborough on the £50 note for all his work saving the natural world
attributes.background: Give Sir David Attenborough the recognition he truly deserves his efforts to educate the general public on the damage we are causing to the world, his work to save the natural world and being an all round great guy.
attributes.additional_details: Sir David Attenborough has tirelessly worked over many years to bring a better level of harmony between humans and the natural world, more so than possibly anyone has before. His work is recognised by many, across all demographics and you'll be hard pushed to not agree the work he does is of upmost importance. Even in his later years, he is spending all his energy, trying to save the world. Put him on the £50 note and help promote the work he is doing and show it will never be forgotten

rejection.details:
Bank notes are the responsibility of the Bank of England, which is independent of the Government and Parliament.

You can find out how the Bank decides who will be on bank notes here:
https://www.bankofengland.co.uk/banknotes/banknote-characters

attributes.action: Do not put the clocks back this October and continue with British Summer Time.
attributes.background: I would like government to suspend daylight saving this year, ie vote to not put the clocks back in October.
attributes.additional_details:
The pandemic second wave is upon us and the mood of the whole country is low. Fewer people are commuting early to work because more are working from home.  Without the need to be up early it is more beneficial to have the light in the evening when most of population can enjoy it. 
With social distancing measures people will only be able to meet outside, so better lighting will make this easier and more energy efficient.
Light exposure may improve vitamin D levels leading to better immunity.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321333

attributes.action: Energy bills need to be waved off during COVID-19 for all citizens of country.
attributes.background: All energy bills need to be waved for every citizen in country during this difficult times. Energy companies need to come forward to take this burden not government as they have earned enough from customers all these years.
attributes.additional_details: This is because when we work from home we use heaters, lights, etc., all day and bills might reach sky high.

rejection.details:
Suspending payments for rent, council tax, mortgages and utilities is a matter for individual landlords, councils, mortgage providers and utility providers, and not the UK Government or Parliament.

If you want the Government to encourage lenders, landlords and utilities to freeze payments during lockdown, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302256

If you want the Government to require councils to suspend council tax payments during the coronavirus outbreak, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/303274

If you want the Government to implement Universal Basic Income to give home and food security during the coronavirus outbreak, you may also wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302284

You can find out  about asking for a mortgage holiday from lenders here: https://www.fca.org.uk/consumers/mortgages-coronavirus-consumers

You can find out about what Government support is available for people as a result of coronavirus (under the section on employment and financial support) here: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/

Read letters asking further questions of Government Ministers: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/
